name: Updater
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater
description: Yielded to a block to accumulate changes for a patch request.

params.name: value
params.description: Specifies a priority for the query. Possible values include INTERACTIVE and BATCH.

methods.name: cache=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#cache=
methods.description: Specifies to look in the query cache for results.

params.name: value
params.description: Whether to look for the result in the query cache. The query cache is a best-effort cache that will be flushed whenever tables in the query are modified. The default value is true. For more information, see query caching.

methods.name: large_results=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#large_results=
methods.description: Allow large results for a legacy SQL query.

params.name: value
params.description: This option is specific to Legacy SQL. If true, allows the query to produce arbitrarily large result tables at a slight cost in performance. Requires table parameter to be set.

methods.name: flatten=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#flatten=
methods.description: Flatten nested and repeated fields in legacy SQL queries.

params.name: value
params.description: This option is specific to Legacy SQL. Flattens all nested and repeated fields in the query results. The default value is true. large_results parameter must be true if this is set to false.

methods.name: dataset=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#dataset=
methods.description: Sets the default dataset of tables referenced in the query.

params.name: value
params.description:
The default dataset to use for unqualified
table names in the query.

methods.name: params=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#params=
methods.description: Sets the query parameters. Standard SQL only.

params.name: params
params.description: Used to pass query arguments when the query string contains either positional (?) or named (@myparam) query parameters. If value passed is an array ["foo"], the query must use positional query parameters. If value passed is a hash { myparam: "foo" }, the query must use named query parameters. When set, legacy_sql will automatically be set to false and standard_sql to true.

methods.name: create=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#create=
methods.description:
Sets the create disposition for creating the query results table.

create new tables. The default value is needed.

The following values are supported:

  • needed - Create the table if it does not exist.
  • never - The table must already exist. A ‘notFound’ error is raised if the table does not exist.

params.name: value
params.description: Specifies whether the job is allowed to

methods.name: write=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#write=
methods.description: Sets the write disposition for when the query results table exists.

params.name: value
params.description:
Specifies the action that occurs if the destination table already exists. The default value is empty.

The following values are supported:

  • truncate - BigQuery overwrites the table data.
  • append - BigQuery appends the data to the table.
  • empty - A ‘duplicate’ error is returned in the job result if the table exists and contains data.

methods.name: table=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#table=
methods.description: Sets the destination for the query results table.

params.name: value
params.description:
The destination table where the query results
should be stored. If not present, a new table will be created
according to the create disposition to store the results.

methods.name: maximum_bytes_billed=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#maximum_bytes_billed=
methods.description: Sets the maximum bytes billed for the query.

params.name: value
params.description:
Limits the bytes billed for this job.
Queries that will have bytes billed beyond this limit will fail
(without incurring a charge). Optional. If unspecified, this will
be set to your project default.

methods.name: labels=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#labels=
methods.description: Sets the labels to use for the job.

params.name: value
params.description:
A hash of user-provided labels associated with
the job. You can use these to organize and group your jobs. Label
keys and values can be no longer than 63 characters, can only
contain lowercase letters, numeric characters, underscores and
dashes. International characters are allowed. Label values are
optional. Label keys must start with a letter and each label in
the list must have a different key.

methods.name: legacy_sql=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#legacy_sql=
methods.description: Sets the query syntax to legacy SQL.

params.name: value
params.description: Specifies whether to use BigQuery’s legacy SQL dialect for this query. If set to false, the query will use BigQuery’s standard SQL dialect. Optional. The default value is false.

methods.name: standard_sql=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#standard_sql=
methods.description: Sets the query syntax to standard SQL.

params.name: value
params.description: Specifies whether to use BigQuery’s standard SQL dialect for this query. If set to true, the query will use standard SQL rather than the legacy SQL dialect. Optional. The default value is true.

methods.name: external=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#external=
methods.description: Sets definitions for external tables used in the query.

params.name: value
params.description:
A Hash
that represents the mapping of the external tables to the table
names used in the SQL query. The hash keys are the table names,
and the hash values are the external table objects.

methods.name: udfs=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#udfs=
methods.description: Sets user defined functions for the query.

params.name: value
params.description: User-defined function resources used in the query. May be either a code resource to load from a Google Cloud Storage URI (gs://bucket/path), or an inline resource that contains code for a user-defined function (UDF). Providing an inline code resource is equivalent to providing a URI for a file containing the same code. See User-Defined Functions.

methods.name: encryption=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
Updater#encryption=
methods.description: Sets the encryption configuration of the destination table.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"

key_name = "projects/a/locations/b/keyRings/c/cryptoKeys/d"
encrypt_config = bigquery.encryption kms_key: key_name
job = bigquery.query_job "SELECT 1;" do |query|
  query.table = dataset.table "my_table", skip_lookup: true
  query.encryption = encrypt_config
end

params.name: val
params.description: Custom encryption configuration (e.g., Cloud KMS keys).
